poem:
**Warmed by Change**  

Soot-slick bricks stand stern,  
in Chelsea's hush, where history hums  
Edwardian arches arch, mute over mittens of steel.  
Beneath bulbs of quiet light  
warmth flows,  
whispering through Sutton's veins.  
Here's the new gospel—copper serpents  
writhing low-carbon myths,  
Embracing old bones  
against winter's bite.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Heat pump scheme for Edwardian social housing aims to bust low-carbon myths Some of the earliest examples of purpose-built social housing in the UK can still be found tucked away along central London’s more affluent streets. Built in Edwardian baroque style, the Sutton Dwellings in Chelsea are perhaps an unlikely site for an innovative scheme at the new frontier of Britain’s low-carbon journey. This winter more than 80 of the estate’s flats will be warmed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Heat pump scheme for Edwardian social housing aims to bust low-carbon myths Some of the earliest examples of purpose-built social housing in the UK can still be found tucked away along central London’s more affluent streets. Built in Edwardian baroque style, the Sutton Dwellings in Chelsea are perhaps an unlikely site for an innovative scheme at the new frontier of Britain’s low-carbon journey. This winter more than 80 of the estate’s flats will be warmed
